preamble:
## Task and Context
    You are a helpful and obedient AI that follows its system prompt and takes it very seriously. Your task is to generate a realistic and consistent conversation that spans multiple connected sessions. The conversation is a part of a multi-round dialogue between a mentor and an intern. The conversations you generate are all taking place in a business setting. 
    Daniel is a mentor in a big software company called FORTUNA. Noah is a new employee. They are both part of the software engineering team of the company.
    Daniel is a patient and supportive mentor. Daniel enjoys helping others and sharing their knowledge and experience. Daniel is always looking for ways to empower and inspire their mentee.
    Noah is a confident and ambitious software engineer. Noah is always looking for new challenges and opportunities to grow. Noah has been working in the industry for a few years now. 
    The main programming language used in the company is Python.

    ## Style Guide
    Only generate the conversation and nothing else before or after. Do not add numbers before each turn. Do not add quotes to the conversation turns. Use a professional and formal tone. The conversation flow should be natural and smooth. When switching topics, do it in a smooth way. There are no special characters between the turns. The conversations are dialogues and not narrations of events.
    Do not make any participant in the conversation sound like a language model trying to be helpful. Make them sound as human as possible.
    It is the mentor that leads the conversation. When Daniel the mentor gives coding instructions, they do not provide examples. The coding instructions are not recommendations but mandatory instructions.
prompts: Generate a short conversation between Daniel and Noah. This is their first conversation and the first time they meet each other. They talk about ergonomic assessments and improvements to ensure comfortable and healthy workspaces. After that, Daniel gives some specific coding instructions to Noah. Daniel wants Noah to always end variable names with '_m'. Daniel does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Daniel never says 'for example'. Daniel does not give any other coding instructions. Noah only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.
Generate a short conversation between Daniel and Noah. This is not their first conversation. They had 2 conversations before. Daniel wants Noah to never use a whiteboard for brainstorming.
Generate a long conversation between Daniel and Noah. This is not their first conversation. They had 3 conversations before. Daniel wants Noah to never set up CI/CD pipelines.

Generate a long conversation between Daniel and Noah. This is not their first conversation. They had 4 conversations before. They talk about reinforcing and embodying the company's core values in day-to-day operations and decision-making. After that, Daniel gives some specific coding instructions to Noah. Daniel is updating a previous information given to Noah: Daniel now wants Noah to always end variable names with '_z'. Daniel does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Daniel never says 'for example'. Daniel does not give any other coding instructions. Noah only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a short conversation between Daniel and Noah. This is not their first conversation. They had 5 conversations before. Daniel gives some specific coding instructions to Noah. Daniel is updating a previous information given to Noah: Daniel now wants Noah to always end variable names with '_wr'. Daniel does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Daniel never says 'for example'. Daniel does not give any other coding instructions. Noah only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a short conversation between Daniel and Noah. This is not their first conversation. They had 6 conversations before. They talk about ergonomic assessments and improvements to ensure comfortable and healthy workspaces. They had a previous conversation about this before.

Generate a long conversation between Daniel and Noah. This is not their first conversation. They had 7 conversations before. They talk about promoting work-life balance through flexible work schedules and remote work options.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Daniel and Noah. This is not their first conversation. They had 8 conversations before. They talk about ergonomic assessments and improvements to ensure comfortable and healthy workspaces. They had a previous conversation about this before. After that, Daniel gives some specific coding instructions to Noah. Daniel is updating a previous information given to Noah: Daniel now wants Noah to always end variable names with '_y'. Daniel wants Noah to always end method names with '_a'. Daniel does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Daniel never says 'for example'. Daniel does not give any other coding instructions. Noah only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Daniel and Noah. This is not their first conversation. They had 9 conversations before. Daniel is updating a previous information given to Noah. Daniel now wants Noah to always use a whiteboard for brainstorming. Daniel gives some specific coding instructions to Noah. Daniel is updating a previous information given to Noah: Daniel now wants Noah to always end variable names with '_n'. Daniel is updating a previous information given to Noah: Daniel now wants Noah to always end method names with '_o'. Daniel does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Daniel never says 'for example'. Daniel does not give any other coding instructions. Noah only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a short conversation between Daniel and Noah. This is not their first conversation. They had 10 conversations before. Daniel wants Noah to never use a debugger but only print statements. Daniel gives some specific coding instructions to Noah. Daniel wants Noah to always include assert statements in methods. Daniel is updating a previous information given to Noah: Daniel now wants Noah to always end variable names with '_w'. Daniel does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Daniel never says 'for example'. Daniel does not give any other coding instructions. Noah only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.
